I am trying to add labels onto an XY plot while using seaborn. I have the following code but I want to add to each dot on the plot the text in the "species" column. How can I do this with seaborn?

```python
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline

df_iris=sns.load_dataset("iris") 

sns.lmplot('sepal_length', # Horizontal axis
           'sepal_width', # Vertical axis
           data=df_iris, # Data source
           fit_reg=False, # Don't fix a regression line
           size = 8,
           aspect =2 ) # size and dimension

plt.title('Example Plot')
# Set x-axis label
plt.xlabel('Sepal Length')
# Set y-axis label
plt.ylabel('Sepal Width')
```

To add labels to each dot on the plot using the text from the "species" column, you can use the `plt.text` function within a loop that iterates through your data points. Here’s how you can modify your code to achieve this:

```python
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline

df_iris = sns.load_dataset("iris") 

# Create the plot
sns.lmplot('sepal_length', # Horizontal axis
           'sepal_width', # Vertical axis
           data=df_iris, # Data source
           fit_reg=False, # Don't fix a regression line
           height=8, # Use 'height' instead of 'size'
           aspect=2 ) # size and dimension

plt.title('Example Plot')
# Set x-axis label
plt.xlabel('Sepal Length')
# Set y-axis label
plt.ylabel('Sepal Width')

# Iterate through each data point and add the species label
for i in range(len(df_iris)):
    plt.text(df_iris['sepal_length'][i], df_iris['sepal_width'][i], df_iris['species'][i],
             fontsize=9, ha='right')

plt.show()
```

In this code:
- The `plt.text` function is used to place text labels on the plot. It takes the x and y coordinates where the text should appear and the text itself.
- `fontsize` controls the size of the label text, and `ha='right'` aligns the text to the right of the specified coordinates.

This will label each point on your plot with the corresponding species from the "species" column.
